unnormalised: **Entertainment Buzz: Bollywood's Box Office Biryani - Who's Serving a Hit?**
normalised: **Entertainment Buzz: Bollywood's Box Office Biryani - Who's Serving a Hit?**

unnormalised: Bollywood's churning out films faster than your aunty can judge your rishta prospects! This week sees a clash of titans, or at least slightly-larger-than-average pigeons, at the box office.
normalised: Bollywood's churning out films faster than your aunty can judge your rishta prospects! This week sees a clash of titans, or at least slightly-larger-than-average pigeons, at the box office.

unnormalised: First up, "Prem's Promise," a rom-com so saccharine it'll give your teeth cavities just from the trailer. Critics are calling it predictable, but hey, who doesn't love predictable during Onam festivities?
normalised: First up, "Prem's Promise," a rom-com so saccharine it'll give your teeth cavities just from the trailer. Critics are calling it predictable, but hey, who doesn't love predictable during Onam festivities?

unnormalised: Then there's "Dharamveer's Dharma Dilemma," an action flick with more explosions than a Diwali fireworks display. Early reports suggest logic took a back seat, possibly to the trunk of a getaway car speeding at 150 kmph.
normalised: Then there's "Dharamveer's Dharma Dilemma," an action flick with more explosions than a Diwali fireworks display. Early reports suggest logic took a back seat, possibly to the trunk of a getaway car speeding at one hundred and fifty kilometer per hour.

unnormalised: Analysts predict "Prem's Promise" will rake in around Rs. 50 crore in its opening weekend, fuelled by families seeking wholesome entertainment. "Dharamveer," with its gravity-defying stunts, might manage Rs. 40 crore, assuming audiences haven't OD'd on masala.
normalised: Analysts predict "Prem's Promise" will rake in around rupee fifty crore in its opening weekend, fuelled by families seeking wholesome entertainment. "Dharamveer," with its gravity-defying stunts, might manage rupee forty crore, assuming audiences haven't O D'd on masala.

unnormalised: The real question is, will either film truly sizzle or just end up as cold leftover biryani? Stay tuned for next week's box office report, where we'll dissect the hits and misses with the precision of a Delhi street food vendor judging gol gappe! And as always, remember to book your tickets!
